alert.note: Alert for Northern Westchester; Orange; Putnam; Rockland; Southern Westchester (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 19 at 11:13AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...AREA OF SNOW WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF THE LOWER HUDSON VALLEY, NORTHEAST NEW JERSEY AND SOUTHWEST CONNECTICUT THROUGH 1215 PM... HAZARDS...An area of snow accompanied by winds of up to 40 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. Visibilities will be between 1/2 and 1 mile at times. Temperatures will be cold enough in some locations for snow to accumulate on all surfaces. Roads in these locations will become slippery. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1109 AM EST, an area of snow was along a line extending from near New Preston to Butler and moving southeast at 35 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Yonkers, Stamford, Waterbury, Norwalk, Danbury, Meriden, White Plains, Wayne, Shelton, New City, Naugatuck, Port Chester, Newburgh, Middletown and Bergenfield. SAFETY INFO... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&

area.areaDesc: Northern Westchester; Orange; Putnam; Rockland; Southern Westchester
